intro: Amitostigma keiskei, commonly known as the Keiske's lily, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern South America. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and delicate, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically produces small, white or pale yellow blossoms that bloom in late spring or early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers shaded to partially shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is often cultivated in specialized gardens and botanical collections.
